name: Christina
info: A Sinner adept at Physical Output. Deals 5% more Damage, and another 5% more for enemies with broken Cores.
maniaIntensifyText: Deals 10% more Damage, and another 10% more for enemies with broken Cores.
criminalRecord:
Currently the Acting Inspector of the Eastside Public Security Bureau, she is also the most troublesome staff member there. She applied four times but was rejected each time, and was finally admitted with her uncle's recommendation.
She has an almost obsessive desire for "justice" and her mental state is unstable. She frequently resorts to violence to solve cases. Her behavior is quite unpredictable. Detainment is advised.

--

Naturally cheerful and optimistic, the subject's unstable mental condition stems from two major incidents: her parents' deaths and the discovery of Shalom's true identity. After being detained by the MBCC, she demonstrated good and helpful behavior without any violations, earning unanimous praise from the Bureau. Under the guidance and company of Chief, she still firmly believes in and pursues justice, but her stubbornness has softened, and she rarely experiences emotional breakdowns or loss of control.
mutationAssessment:
+++* Ability Summary
When she knows she's carrying out "justice", her combat power increases proportionally to the degree of justice. Moreover, she must firmly believe in her own sense of justice, otherwise she will suffer a backlash from her power and fall into depression. Her preferred weapons include a special Detective File reinforced with metal, and a special cane embedded with a small amount of Hypercubes and rare metals. These weapons are highly destructive when used alongside her power.

+++* Awakening Signs
The subject's emotions became extremely unstable after learning of her parents' death. She obsessively compiled relevant evidence and events to uncover the truth and avenge them. After discovering part of what she believed to be the truth, she lost control of her emotions and her power awakened.

+++* Corruption State
Her degree of corruption is mild, and there is no visible lesions on her body. Though she usually appears lively and cheerful, her mental state is unstable. She breaks down and succumbs to self-blame when she cannot achieve justice or is not needed by others.
interrogation1:
Now under the Bureau's supervision, the Chief has been occupying Christina with petty cases to prevent her from dwelling on the events of Flora Unfurl. While reading a headline about a high-profile antique robbery, they receive a message from her requesting an urgent meeting. In the interrogation room, Christina presents them some information regarding a recent theft at a cat cafe, in which a young man identified as Henry broke and stole three cats. The conversation takes a brief turn towards Shalom, but once the Chief gets Christina back on topic, she expresses a great interest in being allowed to go out and solve this case herself. In an effort to raise her spirits, the Chief agrees, but only on the condition that the two of them go together. Christina accepts, happy to formally take the Chief on as her assistant.

//Your "stalling tactic" worked. Christina indeed got distracted by the "Eastside cat cafe theft case" and temporarily put Shalom to the back of her mind. You will help her investigate the case as her "assistant," and search for the cat thief and the missing cat.//
arrestRec1: The subject voluntarily came to the MBCC's doorstep and revealed her identity as a Sinner to Chief. She let the Bureau detain her and actively cooperated with the investigation.
arrestRec2: The subject hails from a military family in Eastside. Both her parents served in the FAC and were killed on duty in N.F. 103. She was later adopted by her aunt's family, who also worked for the FAC. However, her inner turmoil never settled, leading her to obsessively compile relevant evidence and events to uncover the truth behind her parents' deaths and avenge them.
arrestRec3: The subject has known her younger cousin Mireya since childhood, but they often clashed and didn't have a smooth relationship. It wasn't until the Garden assassination case in N.F. 112 when her uncle was killed, that Mireya truly understood and acknowledged her. Their relationship greatly improved afterwards.
arrestRec4: At the lowest point in her life, the subject learned how to use her power. With the help and encouragement of HUSH (Shalom), she embarked on a path of seeking justice. However, she was then traumatized by discovering Shalom's true identity, and became determined to prove her sense of justice to her.
servingTerm1: The luggage she brought with her when she joined the MBCC included a large collection of detective novels, which she continues to add to. The subject is intimately familiar with crime fiction, and has offered many valuable suggestions for mystery-themed films for the Recreation Area's movie nights.
servingTerm2: The subject maintains a positive attitude towards life, taking her daily training and dispatch assignments seriously and always striving to complete them to the best of her ability. Although she often causes equipment wear and tear due to poor control of her strength, she still sets a good example for the other Sinners
servingTerm3: The subject is outgoing and can strike up a pleasant conversation with anyone. She's well-liked within the Bureau, and her positive influence has impacted many Sinners who were originally introverted and melancholic. Additionally, she's known for being always ready to help, and is enthusiastic in helping both Sinners and Bureau staff with life and work problems without expecting anything in return.
servingTerm4: Despite being at the MBCC, the subject has never slackened in her duties and work as the Acting Inspector. She voluntarily uses her downtime to read and organize case files sent by the Public Security Bureau, dragging along Chief, whom she refers to as her "assistant", to work on cases outside.
emotionCheck1:
[Christina is practicing her freestyle fighting skills by pummeling the punching bag in the Training Room.]

**Christina:** Ah, my dear assistant. Would you like to train with me?

**Chief:** ......

* **Prompt:** Fine... Don't hurt me!
 * **Christina:** Don't worry. I know what I'm doing.
 * **Christina:** ğŸ˜‰

* **Prompt:** Ehh... Maybe some other day?
 * **Christina:** Come on. I'll be gentle.
 * **Christina:** ğŸ˜
emotionCheck2:
[Christina is fiddling with a pair of glasses.]

**Christina:** Assistant! Come and check out this new tool I made! It can capture the scene in front of you in the blink of an eye and transmit it to your comms. 

**Chief:** ......

* **Prompt:** Cool!
 * **Christina:** Haha, I knew you'd like it! They are yours. You are very welcome!
 * **Christina:** ğŸ˜˜

* **Prompt:** Can these glasses be used in real life?
 * **Christina:** Of course! They can be very useful in tracking infiltration missions! 
 * **Christina:** ğŸ˜‰
supervision1:
++* âš  Decor Coordinator

//Christina's experience in making detective tools has made her quite skillful in making handicrafts.//

**System Notifications:** Christina's experience in making detective tools has made her quite skillful in making handicrafts. She always takes the initiative to make festive decorations for her favorite Recreation Area.

* **Prompt:** We're counting on you next time.
supervision2:
++* âš  Important Day

//You received a meeting request from [[[list of minor characters |Mireya]]].//

**System Notifications:** Mireya is coming to MBCC to meet Christina, who is getting both excited and a little nervous.

* **Prompt:** She must be missing her a lot.
supervision3:
++* âš  Work Habits

//Christina kept her habits from her time at the local security precinct.//

**System Notifications:** Christina was known for her violent methods in solving cases when she worked at the local security precinct, and this habit of hers hasn't changed since she arrived at the MBCC. Thanks to her, the average lifespan of the furniture in the Bureau has been shortened by 3.5 years.

* **Prompt:** Persuade her

**System Notifications:** With your guidance, Christina has learned to use a lock pick to open doors instead of kicking them down.
supervision4:
++* âš âš  Embarrassed

//Christina requests to enter your office.//

**Christina:** I have an important task for you, my dear assistant.

**Chief:** Uh... What is it?

**Christina:** You don't want to help?

**Chief:** Not at all, I'm more than happy to...

**Christina:** Humph! Then, I hereby announce the mission:

**Christina:** A pet cat named Mimi went missing in the Bureau today! As my loyal assistant, you must help find the missing cat for the poor Sinner!

**Chief:** Wait a minute.

**Chief:** It's just a pet cat. You can find it yourself, right?

**Christina:** About that...

**Christina:** Ahem, anyway, I'll leave it to you, my capable assistant.

* **Prompt:** Check the surveillance

**System Notifications:** Supervision System: A cat is identified in the greenhouse. Multiple facility damages located in the outdoor activity area, kitchen, recreation area, and detention area.

**Chief:** ...

**Chief:** Christina, you did all this, didn't you?

**Christina:** Well... about that...

**Chief:** If you do this again, I won't help you anymore!

**Christina:** Alright, alright...
baseVoicelines:
[Obtain the Sinner]
Mhmm... The righteous MBCC Chief who destroys Black Rings and takes down Corruptors... Ahem, I've decidedâ€”â€”you'll be my assistant! We're gonna crack tons of big cases in DisCity together!

[Raise to Phase 1]
"I'm Christina, the Eastside Acting Inspector who leaves no cases unsolved!" What do you think? Do I sound like a great detective?

[Raise to Phase 3]
"To find justice is to stare the truth in the face," they say. Now I can finally practice that.

[Level Start]
Mhmm... Well! ... What was the first step again? Let me check in my notebook...

[Win Battles]
When you have eliminated the impossible, whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth!

[Lose Battles]
Chin up, assistant! I'll always be with you during our quest for justice!

[Ultimate Skill]
Truth is power!

[Die in Battles]
Sorry... I couldn't...

[Greeting]
My dear assistant, you're just in time! Well... Are there any spare band-aids in the Bureau? If yes, can you do me a favor and put one on my wound?

[Conversation 1]
Alas, this month's repair and compensation bill is huge! I-I swear I didn't break them on purpose! They... they got in the way of my investigation!

[Conversation 2]
What? The door to the Sinner's training room is broken? And the AC is acting up too? Those trapped inside are gonna die from the heat! Ahem, this must be a locked-room mystery! I'm gonna get to the bottom of this!

[Conversation 3]
Taking notes on electronic devices will ruin your eyes! If you end up with blurry vision, don't come crying to me! Here, take my notebook and fountain pen. You'll be better off using them for your notes.

[Special Conversation 1]
I saw this really cool detective at the Public Security Bureau the other day. They called him Doyle! ...What's so funny? He used to be different? In-interesting. I'm gonna look into it.

[Special Conversation 2]
Assistant, what would you do if your little sister never calls you 'big sis'... Should you swallow your pride and call her 'lil sis' first, or... should you write her a letter to say you're sorry... something like that?

[Special Conversation 3]
 There was someone who would always lend me an ear, embrace all parts of me, and guide me just like you. That was once the whole world to me...

[Full Compliance]
Thank you, my assistant, for always being by my side. The road to justice is bound to be long and difficult, but I will give my all for the light at the end. Even so, will you still follow me? Haha, I know you will. Then take my hand and march forward!

[Idle]
Aha! I knew my hunch was right! My dear assistant, quit lazing around in the office, and let's get out there and solve some cases!

[Annoyed]
I made the notebook so heavy, just for... someone like you!

[Special Attention]
My dear assistant, are you drooling over my gadgets? Do you wanna try this mini voice changer or this air pistol? Mm-mm, no touch before taking tutorials. Want me to teach you?

[Dispatch]
Huh? A new case? Let me help! Let me help!

[Dispatch Complete]
Acting Inspector Christina has smashedâ€”â€”Ahh... I meanâ€”â€”solved the case!

[Level Up]
Another step closer to justice!
nightmareTalent: All allied units gain a 12% Physical Damage boost.

exclusiveCrimebrand.name: Justice Obsession
exclusiveCrimebrand.description: Gain a 10% / 12.5% â€‹â€‹/ 15% Attack increase. At the start of the battle, one allied Sinner next to Christina will gain the same damage effect that [Enemy of Evil] has against [Suspect], as well as the recovery effect that [Righteous Triumph] has after taking damage from [Suspect].

maniaIntensify.title: Conquer the Enemy
maniaIntensify.text: Deals 10% more Damage, and another 10% more for enemies with broken Cores.

pros: Heals herself and 1 ally, can replace a healer in the team

crimebrandSets.name: Boss Burst
crimebrandSets.note: Good way to increase damage dealt to enemies that are corebroken. Good for BFL and TOA.

crimebrandSets.name: Energy
crimebrandSets.note: Standard energy set to increase energy generation.

crimebrandSets.name: Attack
crimebrandSets.note: Standard build to increase attack and hp.

shackles.title: Detective Inspiration
shackles.description: [Truth Revealed] Reduce energy consumption by 3 points.

skills.name: Righteous Obliteration
skills.description: Christina attacks with her cane, dealing (Attack * 69%) Physical Damage with each strike.

skills.name: Truth Revealed
skills.description: Christina invokes the power of judgment, dealing (Attack * 750%) Physical Damage and 1 point of Core Damage to all enemies within the skill range.

skills.name: Enemy of Evil
skills.description: [Truth Revealed] Marks the enemy with the highest HP within range as [Suspect] for 10 seconds. Each time Christina deals Normal Attack Damage to the [Suspect], she deals an additional (Attack * 87%) damage. This effect can br triggered a maximum of once per second.

skills.name: Righteous Triumph
skills.description: Each time Christina takes damage from the [Suspect], she recovers 6% HP. This effect can be triggered a maximum of once per second.

compliance: Unlock information: Surveillance Record, Attack +4, HP +64
Unlocking voice: special conversation 1, Attack +5, HP +64, Unlock condition: Use non-assist Christina's ultimate 30 times
Unlock Voice: Special Conversation 3, Unlock condition: Complete Christina's Interrogation.
Unlock File: Surveillance records, Unlock Sticker
Unlock File: Surveillance records, Unlock Voice: Full Compliance, Unlock Sinner Title: Sin Night Seeking Light
supervision5:
++* âš âš  Nickname

//Christina is very popular within the Bureau.//

**Sinner A:** Chris! Could you help me lift this box? It's too heavy, I can't do it alone...

**Christina:** No problem! Here we go...

**Sinner B:** Haha, is that really what you think? You really are hot-blooded!

**Christina:** How can life go on without a bit of passion and excitement...

**Sinner C:** Hey, greenhorn detective, fancy a round of the game?

**Christina:** Come at me! This time I'll wipe you out...

**System Notifications:** As one of the "nosy" Sinners in the Bureau, Christina quickly earns a slew of nicknames. She takes all sorts of bizarre nicknames in stride, but there is one exception.

**Sinner D:** Thanks for the help, you're really my great assistant!

**Christina:** Huh? Assistant?

**Sinner D:** ...What's wrong?

**Christina:** It feels odd... I am a great detective. If one of us has to be the assistant, it should be you!

**Christina:** Uh... that won't work either. I already have a very capable assistant...

**Christina:** Ahem. Anyway, don't call me an assistant next time!

**Sinner D:** Okay...

**Chief:** "A very capable assistant"?

**Chief:** It's quite an honor.
supervision6:
++* âš âš âš  Sixth Sense

//You hear a familiar rush of footsteps outside your door.//

**System Notifications:** Today, just like any other day, you're working in your office when you suddenly hear a familiar rush of footsteps outside.

**Chief:** Chri...

**System Notifications:** Bang!

**Christina:** I can't believe my assistant would do such a thing!

**Chief:** ...Christina.

**Chief:** Is there anything I can help you with?

**Christina:** Don't play dumb!

**Christina:** Your crime can't escape my keen eyes.

**Chief:** What do you mean...?

**System Notifications:** You think for a moment, but you can't recall doing anything outrageous lately.

**Christina:** You must be the culprit of the public fridge theft case!

**System Notifications:** ...You remember now. Last night when you were working overtime, you did go look at the public fridge. Due to the poor lighting, you didn't carefully check if the pudding you took was actually yours. Now that you think about it, there seemed to be a name written on it...

* **Prompt:** Play dumb
 * **System Notifications:** If you think about it carefully, Christina doesn't have any evidence. After you took the suspicious pudding yesterday, you ate it in your own room. No one was around, so it's unlikely anyone saw you.
 * **Chief:** I'm innocent, great detective! I've done nothing wrong!
 * **Chief:** I have plenty of snacks in my own office. Why would I steal snacks from the public fridge?
 * **Christina:** Hmph, I don't believe it!
 * **Christina:** My sixth sense is always right. You're definitely hiding something from me! I won't let this go easily.
 * **Christina:** Wait... Who said the stolen item was a snack?
 * **System Notifications:** Oh no, you let it slip. To make matters worse, you forgot to take care of the trash last night.
 * **Christina:** The detective is now going to search the scene. Everyone, clear out!
 * **Chief:** Wait!
 * **Christina:** Aha, what do we have here?
 * **Christina:** There's the packaging of my pudding in your trash can!
 * **Chief:** I didn't mean to, Christina. I didn't look carefully last night, please don'tâ€”Ah!
 * **System Notifications:** She ransacks all the snacks in your cupboard.
 * **Christina:** Hehe, these will serve as my compensation...

* **Prompt:** Admit it
 * **System Notifications:** You are fully aware that playing dumb in front of Christina will only end up with her searching your office. Not to mention the "evidence" is still in your trash can, you probably won't be able to escape.
 * **Chief:** As expected of the great detective Christina, you caught me.
 * **Chief:** But please let me explain!
 * **Christina:** Hmph, you have one minute.
 * **Chief:** I was working overtime last night. It was late.
 * **Chief:** When I took this pudding out of the fridge, it was just a dark blob, I couldn't see your name written on it.
 * **Christina:** That's no excuse for you to eat my last pudding! Even if you are my assistant, you must accept the judgment of justiceâ€”
 * **Chief:** Hold on!
 * **Chief:** How about this, next time we go out on a mission, I'll take you to the pudding store on Candy Street and buy you three puddings. How does that sound?
 * **Christina:** No, five. Including the limited edition flavor.
 * **Chief:** Alright, alright.

voicelines.Full Compliance - EN: Thank you, my assistant, for always being by my side. The road to justice is bound to be long and difficult, but I will give my all for the light at the end. Even so, will you still follow me? Hah, I know you will. Then take my hand and march forward!

voicelines.Idle - EN: Aha! I knew my hunch was right! My dear assistant, quit lazing around in the office, and let's get out there and solve some cases!

voicelines.Special Conversation 2 - EN: Assistant, what would you do if your little sister never calls you 'big bro'... Should you swallow your pride and call her 'lil sis' first, or... should you write her a letter to say you're sorry... something like that?
